title: Excellent purchase
author: Shawn T. Mcdonough

content: I've thoroughly enjoyed this smaller, lighter, handheld version of the Nintendo Switch. It's the perfect size for a device that you can throw in your bag, but at the same time, has the power to play expansive games that you can get lost in. Honestly, I don't find myself missing the ability to play on my TV or use the detachable Joycons. I know it may sound crazy, but I would gladly trade my Nintendo Switch for my Nintendo Switch Lite, and with the price tag of the former at $100 more, for me, that makes total sense. P.S. If you want to play the SNES games through your Nintendo Switch Online Subscription, this D-Pad is flipping awesome. I can't stop playing Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past!
title: Fantastic!
author: Parker

content: Purchase a switch-lite for my wife as a present since she isn't an avid gamer, but likes handheld games. Got Mario Tennis and Link's awakening for her as a start. She only plays casually and probably used the switch-lite about a dozen times at most over the two months. However, while playing Mario Tennis she already sees the joy-con drift and it is a horrible experience. Can't remove it to send back to Nintendo, and aren't tech savvy enough to tear it down for repairs... Definitely won't get this again.
title: Joy-Con Drift, light use, less than 2 months in.....
author: Alex Lee

content: Everything, nice system comfortable, more durable and comes in many colors. I have a switch so I can still dock into TV. I'd recommend that unless you play only of the go!
title: SEXY TECH
author: Joshua

content: It seems to work, but it arrived with dirt on the joycons, and logged into someone else's account. When I turned it on, it was in Chinese, Japanese, or Korean, I'm not sure which, I'm kind of afraid to touch it without gloves due to the coronavirus. And since the seller didn't bother telling me it was used, I don't know how much it was used, so I hope there's no drift on the joycons or anything else wrong with it.
title: This comes used, but the seller did not specify this.
author: Amazon Customer

content: I bought this switch lite so I could take it with me when I move out so I wouldn’t have to take our family switch. It is soooo great! I bought it used-very good and honestly it almost seems brand new. I was super worried it would come damaged or with scratches or that it would get lost. But nope! Got delivered to my doorstep not a scratch, and even needed a signature too which made me feel so much better!! Anywho about the actual switch. I was also worried that the screen would be too small and I wouldn’t enjoy playing breath of the wild or Skyrim on it (soon the new animal crossing game as well) but while playing, it seems as tho I’m playing handheld on the regular switch (playing docked and on a tv gives me a headache anyway so I prefer this) the only thing I worry about now is the drift issue which happens on the switch where the control sticks start to drift. Luckily I know how to fix that myself (you can watch YouTube videos on how to do it) but unfortunately, instead of just taking apart the joy cons I’m gonna have to take the whole thing apart and get under the motherboard 😅😅😅 so. That hasn’t happened yet but I definitely encourage  Nintendo to do something about that since the lite can’t replace joycons for those who don’t know how to fix them.
title: Cute little guy with big attitude
author: Katie

content: Nintendo really seems to be cheaping out on their consoles now. Not even two months into my ownership of my brand new Switch Lite, and the left joy stick is already going out (the calibration test confirmed my suspicions). Normally, you could just chalk this up to bad luck, a one in a million chance... at least, you would if this wasn't the second consecutive time you've received a lemon console. This same exact issue plagued my new 2DS XL when I bought it 3 years ago, and after that nightmare of a repair I can't believe this happened again. Sent that in for repair and it came back with a loose dust cover flap, along with greasy fingerprints all over both screens! As someone who takes great care of their consoles, I was horrified. With this knowledge comes extreme disappointment that Amazon won't replace my system, as I am very reluctant to send it in to Nintendo's chop shop. The possibility that I could just be sent a refurbished console kills me even more. I bought a NEW console for a reason, why would I want to receive in return something that is anything less? Aside from my obviously bum joy stick, the functionality and appearance of my Switch is otherwise pristine. I mean, I wipe this thing down with my microfiber cloth every time after I turn it off, then promptly put it back in it's case. Considering also all the features I lost, plus a worse battery than the new model Switch, I genuinely feel like I got screwed. Getting $100 off ain't lookin' so good all of a sudden. I would give a lower rating, but the quality of the games I have counter balance it a little. Nintendo loses yet another point in my book.
title: They don't make 'em like they used to
author: Matthew

content: The photos don’t do it justice.  I grew up with Gameboy and super Mario games. I’m also PlayStation fan boy by heart and last time I had Nintendo was the original Wii which I still have. I decided to buy the Gray - Switch Lite since they announced Paper Mario (and rumored Super Mario Galaxy). Nintendo made a smart move by following the trend of remakes because I played these games from night until dawn in elementary school; I am 24 now. I’m so happy I bought the switch lite for its great value. This console is truly pushing the limits to current technology to its maximum. The screen is crystal clear while never compromising the vivid colors and games’ unique styles exclusively on switch & cross platform games. During PS4, I became a huge indie game lover. The second my switch lite came, binge bought a bunch of great games under 9$ with real deals on gems of up to 90% off. My first switch game to buy and play is Planet Alpha (originally 20$ bought for 3.50$) and it’s perfect indie game that truly makes you understand the design of switch lite with comfort and ease; and again never comprising beauty exclusive switch game. The sense of ease and the light portability of the console that does not compromise the beauty of games full immerses you into a personal gaming experience that’s fun at any given moment. I also bought Overwatch on switch, which is also my go to on PS, to try and test my comfort level since I haven’t really played a handheld device in years. Overwatch is a great game to test the comfort on the switch lite because the game utilizes every button on the controller and in a fast paced. After a while it does feel a bit cramped but after adjusting the sensitivity you grow accustomed. OW surprised me so much and it is mind boggling to how they were able to compress the game onto this amazing console. Overall, I am satisfied and excited to spend years exploring the vast and diverse Nintendo library. This console is extremely worth it so far. No doubt Nintendo hit the nail on this console.
title: An immersive gaming experience
author: Victor Ramirez

content: Of course this had to be 5 stars, it's Nintendo! This smaller, more lightweight version of the Switch definitely earns the title of "Lite", but dont let that fool you. Its every bit the power and capabilities of the big guy- just in a smaller, more portable, easier to carry and take with you body. I'd recommend the Switch Lite to casual gamers, those that dont really spend that much time on videogames and their vibe is more tailored to one-player games they catch up with every now and then while theyre in the subway on their way to work or at the kitchen waiting for dinner to finish cooking. The controllers dont detach like the original Switch does, but then again, if youre that much of a casual player, you dont need them too. You can still do multiplayer as long as its online, and in extreme scenarios it does recognize wireless controllers, so you can set it up as a mini screen instead, but that would be something more hardcore gamers would do, and for that, theres the oroginal Switch. This one is more private, more you-exclusive, your own little world just for you and no one else. That's the Switch Lite! And the colors? The original Switch wishes it could do that! Theres three fun colors to choose from (and black, well, more of like a really dark gray). I went with the yellow and havent regretted it since. People who see it love the color too. I hear its the color that most runs out of shelves because people love it so much, but I digress. The Switch Lite is a little beast! And every game for the Switch is just as playable and downloadable in it as it is for the original, and to top it off, its a full one hundred dollars less than the big guy! Itd say for a more personalized, maybe even casual gaming experience, you just cant beat the Nintendo Switch Lite. I love it!
title: A total blast!
author: Frieda Stubbe Deleo

content: I've been waiting since the original Switch's release for a good reason to buy Nintendo's new gaming system. Now that the new Pokemon game is coming out I decided it was time -- just when I had decided on that the Lite was announced and I was delighted! I prefer handheld gaming over tv console which is why I LOVE this new version of the Switch. It's a beautiful thing to hold in your hands. Lightweight and stylish. Battery lasts me about 3 hours when I play games like Breath of the Wild in medium brightness. But it charges in full fairly quickly. Just wished the charging cable was longer.
title: Love my new Switch Lite
author: Samantha

content: I ordered a yellow one thinking it’s coming from the US since I live here but turns out the switch came all the way from Asia! which was bad at first because I thought that there was gonna be a ac adapter problem due to the chargers not being the same as the ones here and not fitting the wall, but they send me a extra top outlet plug thing so I can put that on the charger and plug it in just fine!
title: Be careful what region you buy from!
author: Nadia

content: Second switch I have purchased In a 12 month period. First one I took a loss because it stopped working and Nintendo never responded to my emails. This time around I decided to buy a switch lite. Never held a charge. Switch lite console died and won’t charge. Nintendo won’t help in any way. I googled ways to fix it, tried every single piece of advice. Nothing works. May never buy anything Nintendo again as long as I live.
title: Second console that won’t charge. Nintendo won’t help
author: Steven R

content: I already have the full size switch and was hoping for something more compact for travel.  The lite is great but it is not worth the hassle of having two switches especially if you switch between them regularly as the unit that is not the primary will constantly require an internet connection to see if the game is playable.  I think Nintendo could find a better way to do this as it is really inconvenient if I have to find an internet connection just to play my games.  With the full size switch the connector at the bottom makes sense for docking even if it is annoying but Nintendo should have used the opportunity to put it in a better location. It is absurd that they still, even after all of the comments on the original switch, did not included bluetooth audio capability.
title: Great for a single unit but not worth having a second switch.
author: Brandon

content: I like this system.  1) it's way easier (and way less scary) to throw in my purse and drag around to work and waiting rooms, 2) it's more comfortable to hold than the Switch original, and 3) it's turquoise.  I own a Switch, too, and it's still my favorite console to date, but the SL works for me better as a portable than the Switch does, and that's all I was hoping for with this hand held.
title: Works for Me
author: Katrina

content: This product arrived sooner than anticipated. It was new as described, however it is a European charger.  So I wrapped it,  gave it to my daughter as a Birthday gift, and she was quickly disappointed since you can’t use a European charger in a US outlet. It was definitely a disappointment. Then we took a trip to Target to buy a compatible charger, which was 30.00. Not the way we anticipated giving our daughter her Birthday gift.
title: Needs to provide full description
author: NCBelle

content: Kids fighting over the main switch? Solution: Buy another one Ok it its very first world issue. But my two eldest kids keep fighting over the 1 switch... so the deal? Bring me good grades (at least the middle child) and you get a prize... this was the gift that gives back. Get a Switch Lite and: - Fighting stops - Kiddos play with each other and develops more coop play Also I did install and link the systems to my parental app so I can view what they are doing and for how long and can limit their play times. So all in all worth my sanity and time back and focus on work from home -WoooooooooT!
title: Kids fighting over the main switch?
author: PiyoPiyo

content: I really like the switch lite. I have an original switch as well and honestly I kind of prefer the lite to the original. The lite doesn't dock and connect to the tv but I'm fine with that. I bought one because my wrists don't like supporting weight and my original switch hurt too much when using it in handheld for more than a few minutes. It's much lighter, easier to hold, and is more portable than the original due to it's slightly smaller size/lighter weight.  Setting up a lite if you have a switch already can be confusing, but there are lots of tutorials online and once we got it figured out it wasn't a problem. It's a decent system. I'd recommend it if you plan on traveling a lot with it or don't care about playing on your tv.
title: It's a nice system
author: Coco

content: Santa brought the Switch for our daughter for Christmas this year and we couldn’t be happier! (: Her grandparents got her a game for it in the little chip form and she has a free game that we downloaded for her as well and she seems pretty content with that selection so far. I had read reviews before we bought the Switch that people didn’t like the account set up and what not but we have not had issues because we only have 1 Switch and probably only will ever have 1. Also we have not noticed any problems with the control sticks yet. That was another issue that scared us a little about this Switch. Overall, so far, i’d Say it’s a great product and worth the money. Plus the color is outstanding! It’s a crazy vibrant yellow like we had hoped.
title: Worth the money
author: Alaina Luedtke

content: This lasted about 10 days before i began noticing a deadzone with the left analog. While playing Zelda i started noticing when i pressed forward/up on the left analog stick Link would just stop in the middle of running. Then he would start moving forward slowly, then run, then stop, then walk. Pretty much made playing any game impossible. What really angers me is the fact that Nintendo knows this issue exists. Sent Switch Lite back for refund. A pretty miserable first experience with the Nintendo Switch.
title: Left analog Deadzone.
author: soonergiant65

content: I got this because I love gaming and I don’t have time to anymore and with a child I can’t play the games I used to love because they aren’t appropriate...with this little console I can play when I have a free moment or the family is napping and I don’t have to disturb anyone! It’s worth the money! plus, I’ve played handheld on a friends switch and the lite just feels so much lighter, more natural, and more solid in the hand! the ONLY thing I don’t understand is why it’s 2020 and this little console doesn’t have Bluetooth but it doesn’t bother me enough to rate it lower, I just used wired headphones with it...you can buy an adapter if you want...
title: Wonderful little console!
author: Chris Arnett

content: The switch lite is an awesome console period. I don't play my games on the go, but I got the lite for the $100 savings over the regular switch. You get to play the entire switch library on a portable device. I got a case and screen protector and I was good. I initially gave the switch lite a one star review because I was having trouble with it using my micro sd card. I need to apologize to Nintendo because I discovered those issues were happening because I  was using an inauthentic Sandisk mirco sd card! After returning the bad micro sd card and picking up a real one on Amazon, everything worked great...so 5 stars it is.
title: Great Value from Nintendo
author: Kiran

content: Perfect for those that already own a Nintendo switch and want a dock less switch. I absolutely love the switch lite my Nintendo switch that i keep at home i can sync with the switch lite and continue my game play transferring my save data between the two.
title: Perfect for anyone
author: Ruben Jimenez

content: Love my Switch, but some commonly used buttons are starting to have response issues after only three to five months of steady use. I bought a transparent case and screen protector for it so I can’t comment on its own physical durability. The Switch Lite is overall a good size, shape, and look. I’ve used (but didn’t have) the regular Switch, but haven’t felt like I’m missing out on anything, since I just wanted a handheld device and not a TV-connected console. I basically feel like I have a lesser DS (no stylus, no flip design, no double screens, not as portable), but with a bigger screen for visuals and a better, newer games library than the DS had. The buttons dilemma hasn’t made it unusable yet and it has been a good source of fun, so for now I still think it was worth the purchase.
title: Great purchase, button issues within months however
author: MLP

content: The only cons of this console(which im going to call "lite") is that it doesnt support some games and the joycons that dont detach. Besides that the lite feels much more durable than the switch, similar to the feeling of the original bulky DS. If you already have a switch and looking for a second for a bf/gf, kids, etc, this is the perfect solution at $100 off. You never have to worry about the battery life of the joycons(because there are none.) Now if you dont have the original switch, I would recommend evaluating what youre going to buy the consoles for. If youre looking to buy party games, go with the original. If youre looking for single player games like mario and pokemon, i definitely recommend the lite.
title: Perfect for the second console
author: Stinky

content: First: GET A SCREEN PROTECTOR PLEASE!!! If you're like me, you're on a tighter budget, so you grabbed this because it's cheaper and smaller. But get a normal switch. Trust me. I love the handheld experience but it becomes a bit much on the eyes so switching to a TV would've been a convenient way to ease that. Playing with friends? Eh... Other than that 5 stars because it does what it says flawlessly. The games are fun, the handheld experience is great, it's not as heavy as a normal switch. Oh and get a screen protector because these things are insanely too easy to scratch up. I made that mistake and I'm paying for it. Figuratively and literally. To sum this all up, if you're looking for a cheap alternative to the switch and you don't mind losing the ability to dock it to a TV and replace joycons, and like the handheld experience, get this by all means. If you want to be able to play with a sibling or friends, save up that extra $100 because it's so much more worth it.
title: I loved this, but get the normal switch.
author: Michael Dorso

content: Had it for almost a week and enjoying it. A few hiccups here and there but nothing major. Bought some accessories for it too. Just wish software can continue to download without stopping in the process while in screen lock. Also, wish it had built in bluetooth. It’s 2020 and I was quite shocked to learn that none of the switches (regular and lite) have built in bluetooth, so I will have to buy a bluetooth adapter for it. I am not a fan of the built in speakers. Some games allow the full range of volume, while some make the system sound very low which is the reason I want bluetooth to use my JBL speaker for a better experience. It’s a handheld, which I understand, so I am not too bothered by it. Overall, I still prefer over the regular because I wanted a handheld for personal experience rather than share with others. It’s a cute color.
title: Beautiful but Flawed
author: Erin M.

content: It's same great Nintendo Switch Console and yes you can play all your games, but there are 2 huge differences compared to the regular Switch!  Controllers aren't detachable and you can't play it on your TV!  If you only play on the go (while you're on the bus, etc), this is the system to get, but if you're like me, I play it on my TV and often play on the plane by attaching the screen to the seat in front of me, I would recommend paying the extra $100 to get the Switch.  Teal color is beautiful, everything works other than that.  One more note!  You can't transfer Animal Crossing save files from system to system.
title: A little mixed on this...
author: K. Yagi

content: Nintendo did not fix their dreaded joycon drift. After two months of owning this, I have had a faulty joycon and a fan that sounds like a lawn mower.
title: DO NOT BUY!
author: Brian Hatzelhoffer

content: The Switch Lite, I could go on for hours about this gaming platform so make this simple. Do you want to play all the great switch games in only handheld? Do you not have the $300 for the regular switch? Do you not care about having a TV or using one in your home? Do you prefer portability and like the colours, #GreyGang? Get the Switch Lite, it is definitely worth it. Also invest in a screen protector or a case to keep it well protected.
title: Nintendo did it again
author: Cody Ramcharan

content: I never owned a switch before, nevertheless a switch lite, so I’m no expert. However, the console has been working very nicely and in terms of quality of the product, shipping, and price it was a really good purchase! I really love the color in my switch, it’s just really vibrant and beautiful. I recommended buying the switch lite to people who want a less expensive version, and are fine without some abilities that the lite doesn’t have in contrary to the actual switch. It still does it’s job as switch console and plays the games I was looking towards playing. So I’m really happy with my switch lite!
title: I love my switch lite and I’m happy I can finally play with my very own!
author: Phoebe L.

content: If you’re not looking to add another console next to the PS4 this is a perfectly built system. One charger cord and that’s it, keep it simple. Extremely light and comfortable in hands, screen brightness and sound are good, D Pad is a much needed upgrade. Plus, you can run SNES games off it to through the Nintendo subscription. Don’t hesitate you won’t be disappointed.
title: If you don’t want another console this is the future of handhelds
author: JL

content: I love it!!! Easy to use and durable. I love the fact that you can easily take this on the go. Doesn’t connect to the tv like the Nintendo switch original version. You can play with friends vía wifi or local. You do have to pay for an online membership if you are wanting to play with friends via internet. Graphics are amazing on this and charging is fast. The battery will last you a long time.
title: Portable light weight easy to use.
author: Missmami

content: Switch Lite feels great to hold, love the matte finish. Love this handheld But that did not last long.... My left analog, when held to right, it keeps moving back to center or sometimes just does not move from the center at all.... It is hard to recommend Lite since Switch original can easily swap out Joy-con...
title: Fantastic Handheld but analog..
author: EnragedBubble

content: I decided to buy the grey one after much deliberation over which color I wanted. I've already played almost 50 hours on my favorite game and I was right to pick a neutral color to not burn my eyes on as I played. All in all, the left joystick is more loose than I would have preferred but the right one is solid and the d-pad is nice to have (missed it from the handheld era and I'm glad it's back). Highly recommended purchase if you have a game you're dying to play and you love portability.
title: Currently loving it
author: Yve

content: The Nintendo Switch lite is the new member to the switch family. As the name says it, the switch lite is a “lite” version of the original switch. Witch mean it isn’t “dockable” and the joy cons can’t be removed. It’s a one piece unit and it plays all if not, most switch games. It’s light weight and rests comfortably on your hands, the console is made out of plastic and therefore it has a “plastic-y“ feel but it doesn’t feel like cheap plastic. In my eyes it is a perfect console for those who are looking for a portable console with a massive library of games that range from first to third party games with many genres. My only complaint has to be the battery life. It would have been a perfect console if the battery life lasted 8-10 hours. The Nintendo Switch lite gets a rating of 9.5/10
title: Almost Perfect. Great Console nonetheless.
author: Edward Zamora

content: I absolutely love the switch lite! Yeah, it doesn't dock for TV use, but that's not what this device is for! Rather than being a switch, it is more a switch-like successor to the 3DS family. It is meant for portability and mostly single player use, which this is absolutely perfect for! I also absolutely love that this unit uses plastics that are durable, yet very soft and pleasant to touch! I have zero issues with this unit and zero regret buying it. Thank you Nintendo, for making this product
title: WORTH IT!
author: Andy McClain

content: I bought this for my husband for Christmas a few months ago, but I ended up just keeping it and playing The Legend of Zelda Link's Awakening on it. I played the heck out of that game when I was a kid on my Gameboy Color, and once I started playing the new version on this Switch, it all came back to me. The Switch Lite is really comfortable to play and lightweight. I think holding the regular Switch with the controllers attached is really awkward, so we just let our son play that and I've been keeping this little secret to myself ;). My husband changed his mind about what he wanted for Christmas anyway, so don't feel bad for him lol
title: Much more comfortable to play handheld than the regular Nintendo Switch
author: Mag Summers

content: I got the lite because the price of the regular switch console just kept going up. The switch lite arrived within a decent amount of time. I've probably had it for two months now and I like the feel of lite, but I really do wish it had an adapter or something to connect to the tv because the smaller screen just doesn't bring home the intensity for some games. The lite works just fine and all the parts were in it. As you can see in my, I've modified my lite. The thumb grips seemed like a must for the lite, as without them my thumbs kept slipping off the analog sticks and I kept accidentally pressing in on the analog stick on some games trying to make keep my thumbs from slipping when i needed to attempt soft maneuvers. Battery lasts about 2.5 hours, so i don't have to worry too much about charging when I'm on the go.
title: It's not as great as the original switch, but if you need an alternative, this can work.
author: Julian Barrett

content: I love it, it's a switch lite. it works just as good as a normal switch, except its strictly handheld, which is not a problem to me, also its super cute, u arent able to choose a theme other than black or white tho, i hope that changes. I like to customize my stuff so a star is lost
title: i like this switch
author: Brianna

content: I really like the idea of having a smaller, more portable version of the switch. This model is great for roadtrips, killing time at the DMV, or plainly just for playing all of those titles that are being remade for nostalgia purposes. The only thing i really dislike is the button layout. Having the joystick directly under the numerical buttons normally used for strategic moves in shooters  makes games like that a little harder if you dont have a pro controller. Overall id give this system a 9/10 with its only draw back being the button layout
title: Fun system
author: Justin Reed

content: Purchased this to help me get through 2020. Best decision ever. Playing all of the Dragon Quest games the switch has available including the DQ11. I did read that many people have problems with the drifting of the controllers and was worried about that, but after months of heavy use I still don’t have any problems. I’ve played well over hundreds of hours so I got my money’s worth. I know it’s hard to get across a switch these days or even a switch lite, but keep an eye out and it’s totally worth paying the original price.
title: Getting me through 2020
author: IT

content: bought this a month ago when it was sold by the nintendo company, $199 plus shipping and tax with ended with $123. Came packaged securely and with a charger and the switch in a plastic bag. The battery lasts about four hours for me but three hours when it’s 15%. Bought games for it and the game play is really good graphics and nice feel to it. The joycons have a grip to it and nice the buttons are soft also. Played animal crossing with my friends who also have switch lites and easy connection to the internet. But if you want to play online with local or friends you have to have internet connection! With wifi, it connects just fine and smoothly but with hotspot to a phone or device, it disconnects easily and really angers me. I’ve played many games on it Mario odyssey, Luigis mansion 3, Animal crossing new horizons, and many more and all are good quality. I sometimes give to my little brother and he dropped it a couple times but the screen didn’t crack (Since it’s plastic) and the side buttons click fine. I don’t think it necessary to get a case and screen protector for the switch but your choice is fine. If you already have a the original or newer version of the switch I recommend you shouldn’t get this switch bc it has less features. if you don’t have a switch, this is a really good alternative to the original switch and cheaper regarding the sellers that buy the switches and sell for more. Personally I recommend this switch to new users in the nintendo community! I play this god sent thing everyday nonstop and sometimes I have to force myself to stop! I don’t recommend to buy rn in this pandemic with the prices up to $399, wait have patience and you’ll love this thing!
title: Hotspot disconnection
author: huyen

content: The system feels like matte paint it doesnt or feels glossy. I like it this way, less finger prints etc.. but it can get dirty and stained quicker. Can not be atached to tv like the previous one. That i dont like as much but if u have both like i do. I just use this one as a back up. At first i thought u couldnt do multiplayer cuz, you cant remove the joy cons. But if you own or buy another set, it can still be detected.in other word you can still play mario party , kart etc 2,3 or 4 players..the downside again  no tv. But so far the console responds and its still the same switch.
title: Doesnt connect to a tv
author: 9artsdragon

content: I got myself one of these, and my boyfriend one as well!  I absolutely love Nintendo products, and I haven't been disappointed by these consoles.  They feel great to hold in adult hands, and the buttons are clicky and satisfying. Super intuitive gameplay, and so worth the money!  I prefer handheld gaming over TV play, so this was a much better deal for me than the original Switch.
title: Fantastic handheld gaming device!
author: Angel

content: Lost a star for price gouging. Still got 4 for it not being as bad as others; and for arriving a day early with the box in ok condition. (It was in a box itself so this happened before shipping) As for the Switch itself, my daughter absolutely is in heaven with it right now. It has tons of games she likes from the Ps4 and tons more she hasn't even heard of. Plus she loves Pokémon and this is the system for that! Now I can play my Playstation in peace! So since we all got what we wanted in the end, I'll only complain a little, lol.
title: We all won in the end.
author: Fyonna Ashley

content: Full disclosure: I have a full size switch.  The switch lite really pales in comparison to the regular switch, and it's not that much cheaper.  The screen isn't as vivid, it can't connect to the tv, I can't customize the joy cons, and overall it just feels cheaper in hand.  That being said, it plays all of the same games as the regular switch and does seem more durable since it's a solid piece of plastic, and for that reason I trust it more in the hands of my younger family members.
title: Not really impressed
author: FA

content: The Nintendo lite was never meant to port for multiple people onto the Nintendo lite. This was explained well by Nintendo before the launch. I see a lot of complaints about this issue. Always study what your buying. Nintendo won't admit it fully but this will take over the Nintendo 3DS. Also wouldn't be surprised if they start the process of closing the Nintendo DS line. The Switch is a perfect handheld for the future and will go on even after the new Nintendo system comes out in the next 3-5 years.
title: The Lite is a perfect handheld
author: William Lund

content: Words can’t describe how much I love this little device honestly I been doing my research about this and the regular switch. I was stuck between which one I should get and honestly I just stuck with my gut &  chose the lite. Honestly, screen is a nice size for me.  I’m glad that I bought this thru this trial time being in this pandemic and I absolutely love the turquoise it’s very vibrant. And I love the matte finish doesn’t seem like it will be slipping out my hand any time soon.  Next is to buy few accessories for this lil guy.
title: It’s finally in stock!
author: Bbreezye

content: The product arrived in a box that looked like it had been dropped a few times, the packaging inside the box was in rough shape too. The game system itself appeared to be unused but my first impression wasn’t a good one. I haven’t had any issues with the system so far! I do wish that the battery would last a bit longer, it’s very lightweight so if they had to make it a bit heavier to increase the battery life I would be fine with that. The online gameplay is not good, I have yet to try a LAN connection but I’m hopeful that it’s better than the online connection.
title: Nifty portable gaming system
author: E. Glover

content: Muy bueno, en especial para lo que solos piensa en portable
title: Muy bueno
author: Amazon Customer

content: I really didnt want to buy a lite because I wanted to buy the regular switch. However, after the high demand for the switches and high prices I decided to go for a switch. The color is absolutely beautiful! I think its the best color out of all the switches! The lite is light and easy to carry. I use it to play animal crossing and I love it! If you don’t want to spend as much money on a regular switch make sure you buy a lite! Definitely worth its money value!
title: Coral Lite
author: Arlene

content: Do you have ~400 for a switch without price gouging+animal crossing but America is taking a dump on you trying to be a consumer? Just get the switch lite, especially if you owned any handheld in the past and enjoyed it, you're missing out on a gimmick not a life changing feature. If you can find the actual joy in games in the games themselves, you'll be absolutely fine. If you've always had the ability to just have fun on whatever is around whether its league on a computer or a retro emulator, you really will be fine. And you'll have gathered another 350 to buy a switch at a normal price by the time the price gouging is over so you'll fully be in the ecosystem lol
title: Buy it because you want animal crossing now
author: Apex Nights

content: I have been waiting since the original switch release date for Nintendo to come out with a handheld only version. And here it is. I'm 40+ years old. Hogging the TV for hours on a console is out of the question. But playing on the switch while sitting with the family during tv time is great. The switch lite feels much more comfortable to hold compared to the full size version.
title: More portable then full size switch
author: John

content: I love it! I got this at the beginning of the pandemic (in March) to keep myself entertained. Normally, I wouldn’t have enough spare time to play. Now I can totally see myself using this to relax at the end of a busy day. I love that it’s light weight, I can use it in bed very comfortably, and it’s easy to use.
title: Highly recommend!!
author: Zander

content: It's used but works like brand new. They included the game and the charger, which was all I needed. Every other place right now is gauging prices like crazy. A Switch Lite should only cost $199, but everywhere that still has them is charging between $260-$320 at the moment. I got lucky enough to find this place selling a used SL for $169 and it was worth every penny. The game system is light and easy to handle while still feeling sturdy. The screen shows off a super clear picture and so many details that it blows my mind to realize we've come this far with hand-held systems. The controls respond very quickly, and I'm incredibly happy with my purchase.
title: The only place that didn't gauge prices
author: Angela

content: I bought this for my boyfriend who is normally a PC gamer (and who chose the 5-star rating for this review), but he wanted to play a few certain switch games. He really loves it and to my surprise wishes he had some of his PC games on the Switch Lite instead. He likes the d-pad on the right which the normal switch doesn’t have since the joycons all need to be the same. The one con to this compared to the normal switch is that if it’s low on battery and he wants to play, he needs to sit by the wall to charge it. No docking option. Games with a lot of text are especially nice for him on this because he has a hard time reading the text on the TV, but not when playing handheld. Of course you could achieve this with a regular switch, but at a higher price point. So in conclusion, if you have a hard time with reading on the TV and would like to play handheld all of the time, this is a great alternative to the normal switch. On the other hand, if you like playing on the TV or if your eyes have a hard time looking at small, close up screens for long periods of time like mine, the normal switch is worth the cost.
title: Awesome device for those who like playing handheld
author: Carrie Rider

content: I bought a used switch lite specifically for ACNH and by description, this one was to have little signs of usage and to fully work with charger included! The switch is in extremely good condition and only has two or three barely visible scratches. Along with some light marks on the back, but again you can barely see it. I'm buying a skin so it won't matter regardless. Delivery was to be expected on a specific date and it came right on time! So happy with this purchase, thanks so much!
title: Exactly as described!
author: Monique

content: I have to say this is a quality kit and I am using most of what came with it.  Case is top notch the glass screen protectier is perfect and the back plate cover makes the switch much easier to hold.  Can not go wrong for the price!  I will say if you own a yellow switch Lite like I do put some paper towel inside the case where the back plate grips lay inside as mine did get some black staining.  I wrote to the company and hopefully they correct this. Must have kit if you buy a Switch Lite!
title: Items you need for your Switch Lite and color matches perfect!
author: LindaFus

content: Paid a little more than I wanted for this but supply and demand forced my hand. It's the switch, but lite... What else is there to say. Battery life is a little better. Graphics look the same. Worth it for on the go gaming. Or laying in bed gaming (my favorite). Edit: The built in speakers on the lite are not great at all. I don't know if the regular version is the same. Get some decent head phones for it.
title: It's the switch, but lite...
author: SofaKinHii

content: I got tired of my friends playing all of the cool games without me, so I jumped on the bandwagon. It's a cute lil handheld. Everything is comfortable enough to handle, but you might find the plastic kinda slippery. That's fixable with a rubber case. It gets decently loud and the screen looks good in all light. My only suggestion is that you definitely NEED a hardshell case because the joycons have a reputation for breaking and they're much harder to fix on the Lite than the regular.
title: I'm Finally Part of the In Crowd!

content: Los niños lo aman, practico para llevar a todos lados
title: Nintendo

content: My 10 year old wanted a switch. I was hesitant due to his lack of accountability and the price. This was a great choice. No lost joycons, though they are available to connect, and it has held up to his insistence on leaving it where it could be stepped on or sat on. I use it to relive the glory days of Donkey Kong and the visual quality of the screen is better than I expected. The device sized well so that it is comfortable for myself or my son to play. If you are not sure about a switch, I recommend the light.
title: Glad I chose this one.
author: mreadr

content: When the package arrived I couldn't believe how small it's dimensions were! But hey after a few hours of playing ssbu I got used to it, my hands just adapted. I recommend getting a device case and screen protector as the screen isn't made of glass and more of a plastic material.
title: Smaller than you think

title: Perfect
author: SPAM

content: Highest quality (dedicated) Nintendo handheld since the 3DS XL. 2/3 the weight of the big Switch, and the cloud sync feature with Nintendo Switch Online is absolutely lovely (for the most part). The missing features are glaring, but if you have a Switch, (for example, a family Switch that's always in the living room/den,) then a family NSO subscription and a handful of Switch Lites is the *perfect* gift. Just make sure you set up the eShop accounts on the Switch Lites *first*, and then log in on the main unit.
title: Highest quality, at a discount, plus easy online syncing
author: John B

content: Love It! Have thought about getting a Nintendo switch one day, wanted to, glad I got the Nintendo Switch Lite! It is fun! Glad can play Nintendo switch games on it! Very good system! The only console worth spending money on (in my opinion) is Nintendo, the only console that seems to have withheld their exclusive titles to some degree. Mario, Link, and the rest of them aren’t coming to pc anytime soon. So in my mind, if you really want to bang for your buck, Nintendo switch has far more content, that can’t be played on anything else. Awesome console that boasts some of the best titles available anywhere!
title: Excellent all around!

content: I have the original switch which is great but not very portable the joy cons are easily messed up if not carful so when Nintendo came out with the new coral switch lite I had to get it! The seller was amazing the day I put in the order I got it delivered the very next day! It came brand new with everything I’m so happy with it. I highly recommend it but if you are a family with kids and want multiple switches connected to the same account you’ll need to invest in cartridge games.
title: So happy!!!

content: I've wanted a Nintendo Switch, however already owning a PS4 and using a Gaming PC I didnt want another console and I didnt wanna dish out money for a console I wouldnt use. Only complaint is it wasnt very hand ergonomic, but we each got a case for it and problem solved! 4/5 due to Ergo issue.
title: Console Convince and Value
author: Jerome Wilson

content: I LOVE my Nintendo Switch Lite. I’m simple; I grew up on Super Mario and the Wii. This newest update for single handheld gaming is great for someone who just wants to play games like Animal Crossing: New Horizons by herself. title: Over all very disappointed :(

content: This is basically a value version of the Nintendo Switch. It's a bit more "portable" since it doesn't come with the dock and is also lighter. The joy cons are not removable. While having color options are kind of cool I feel like it's better just to buy the Nintendo Switch instead.
title: Discount Nintendo Switch
author: Consumerist

content: After a little trouble with UPS delivering this to an empty house a street over from me, I finally got my Switch lite and Pokemon Sword. I haven’t really gotten to play; Im a teacher and have to be in bed by a certain time. That being said, what I have gotten to do it so much fun. I love how the Switch feels, it’s easy to get used to and I love that I can walk around with it very easily. Breath of the Wild is my next purchase and I’m excited to finally play it.

content: I do not like this Switch Lite at all. I bought the original Switch for my oldest son 2 years ago and I bought this Lite for my youngest. author: Kiley

content: I order this a while back before giving it to my son (I knew inventory was low and wasn't sure when/if we'd be able to get another later on). I'm pretty disappointed considering I paid more than what it was worth in the first place.
title: One day out of box and will not charge
author: Mlmarc

content: I’m in love. Amazing handheld console. Great quality screen resolution. So lightweight and portable. Perfect for what I need. The sound quality on it is okay. title: Lovely device.
author: Omar

content: When I finally had to ability to purchase a Nintendo Switch, I was super excited because I wanted to play the new Animal Crossing game. When it arrived I set up the system like normal and then purchased the said game. Then next thing I see is a completely white game. I can still interact with it like normal but I can't see my game at all. I sent this issue to Nintendo and its undergoing investigation. I originally thought the issue was just with Animal Crossing but when I downloaded another game for free, the same issue occurred. I don't know if there is an issue with my console itself, but I feel I wasted a good amount of money with this.

content: Been wanting a switch for a while but since the full sized switch is sold out everywhere or hella high price gouged Super happy with my purchase! Been great for killing the boredom during quarantine
title: Awesome!

content: It is exactly what you expect, a smaller version of the switch without removable controllers.  The front buttons (ABXY) are slightly more gentle feeling than the regular switch. I do wish that it would allow you to dock when there was a bluetooth controller connected though.  I think that is my issue I could think of.
title: It does what a switch does but smaller
author: zequ;

content: Ever since I bought a switch for myself, I cant stop playing it. Ofc, I picked the yellow color but there's also turquoise, grey, and coral pink to choose from out of the lites. I thought that was kinda disappointing.
title: Great Console
author: Weaboobs

content: I bought the grey switch lite for my brother and he loves it. It is significantly lighter weight than my original switch therefore making it great for travel. My husband now wants one. If you have kids it’s great for them to each have their own without breaking the bank to buy several original switch’s.
title: Love it
author: RDS

content: I sold my Console Switch after buying this. The lite is better for mobile gaming, if you need something for the commute or whatever. The switch lite is what you should get. The console switch is good for people who activly play on a TV with friends, if you're a solo mobile gamer, get the lite.
title: Light weight and compact.
author: Aaron Myers

content: Had to replace my new Switch Lite due to broken left control stick. It suffers from all of the drift issues that is so common for this system. Will be deeply upset if my replacement Switch Lite is also broken, but I wouldn't put it past it. The design on these sticks almost ensure that they will malfunction within 2 years, and as for me, sometimes right away. Edit: Second lite has now also has joycon drift after about a month of moderate playing. Let's go Amazon, I'll take a third....
title: Joycon Drift/Broken Control Stick At The Word Go
author: Alexander

content: We've had this Switch Lite for less than a month. The left joystick had a piece of plastic come free from underneath and wedge itself inside of the stick rendering it useless. We've never dropped it or had it otherwise damaged. Nintendo support said they would charge $89 to repair it as their warranty doesn't cover physical damage even if the product was faulty. Amazon support just says to talk to nintendo.
title: Nintendo support is terrible
author: DeAnne Peek

content: I love everything, except one flaw, about my Gray Switch I ordered here! I ordered my own Swith specifically so I don't have to share my Animal Crossing with my young kids.. 😂) The packaging, the colors I expected it to be, the service in general, and appearance in general are all great. The functionality of my Switch is great but right outta the box the left Joy Stick lags and gets slightly stuck in places. The lag isn't HORRIBLE but it is noticeable! The sticking is slightly worst. I think the Joy Stick is offset slightly to the left. It can get extremely aggravating at times. I'm not sure if this is a known issue with Switch Lites or not but I've had mine for about a month now and I'm gonna start investigating the issue. I also wish I had read and known that the Switch Lite does NOT have the vibration option. (Its hard to catch fish on Animal Crossing without it. 😅) Other then that, I'm extremely happy with it all around! :)

author: Susan Darden

content: It was ok, but I returned it for the Switch. The screen on this one is too small for me to play on. I have no issues reading the text on the Switch now.

author: Ken

content: Item broke right out of the box. Serial # on device did not match serial number on the box. We were able to contact Nintendo directly to coordinate a repair which will take 4 weeks. This was a birthday gift for my granddaughter.  To have a piece fall off the device when taken out of the box is unacceptable.  She was very disappointed as was I. This is a hard to find item so I had limited choices.

content: If you have a normal switch don't bother buying this. If you don't have a normal switch or is thinking of either buying the normal switch vs this, get the normal switch. The switch lites buttons are wobbly(reminds me of 3ds), the sticks are not as sturdy, the screen is almost soft plastic (must buy screensaver). All in all its  what you expected of a downgraded version, I bought 2 switch lites and I love them.

content: Don’t waste your money, save it for buying a full switch.
